H0.text: The information on the strand always changes when the nucleotides in a strand of DNA are rearranged.

H1.text: The mass of the strand changes whenever the nucleotides in a strand of DNA are rearranged.

H2.text: The organism dies when the nucleotides in a strand of DNA are rearranged.

H3.text: The organism always thrives when the nucleotides in a strand of DNA are rearranged.

A4.text: It is the sequence of these four nucleobases along the backbone that encodes genetic information.
